thread.title: Blind Date bosses want Kylie Minogue to be 'the new Cilla Black' as show makes big comeback
thread.title_full: Blind Date bosses want Kylie Minogue to be 'the new Cilla Black' as show makes big comeback

author: Zoe Shenton
title: Blind Date bosses want Kylie Minogue to be 'the new Cilla Black' as show makes big comeback
text:
TV Blind Date bosses want Kylie Minogue to be 'the new Cilla Black' as show makes big comeback The classic TV dating show will be back on screens later this year - but who will be replacing beloved Cilla Black? Share Will Kylie be replacing Cilla? Share Get celebs   Thank you for subscribing! Could   
TV bosses have reportedly got their sights set on Kylie Minogue becoming the new Cilla Black as Blind Date makes its big comeback this year. 
The much-loved dating show was hosted by beloved Cilla for nearly two decades before she hung up her matchmaking heels in 2003 and the show was cancelled. 
It was initially thought former Geordie Shore babe Vicky Pattison was in the running to become the new host, but producers are now believed to be keen to hire newly single pop star Kylie. 
“They know this is their chance to land an A-lister and Kylie has been discussed because she is so likeable," a source said. Blind date with Cilla Black (Photo: LWT) Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Share this video Watch Next 
They added to The Sun: “Blind Date has such a huge legacy and Channel 5 has had so much success with Celebrity Big Brother and Lip Sync Battle, it gives them a calling card to attract the best.” It was rumoured Vicky Pattison was also in the running (Photo: Instagram/vickypattison) Read More Vicky Pattison backed as new Blind Date host by Cilla Black's son when it makes its comeback 
Also said to be in the frame is singer Olly Murs, 32, as well as actresses Georgia May Foote, 25, and Helen Flanagan, 26. Cilla Black attends the first 'Blind Date Wedding' - 1991 Sue and Alex Tatham, the first couple to marry after appearing on the programme (Photo: Rex) Blind Date (Photo: ITV) Cilla Black's close pal Christopher Biggins SLAMS the return of Blind Date 
The show will be produced by So Television – which makes The Graham Norton Show – and Stellify Media - a company part-owned by Sony Pictures Television. 
It's expected to appeal to “a new generation of viewers” while keeping some of the “traditions of the past”. Kylie Minogue Read More Bonkers dating show Game Of Clones lets singletons design their dream lover before choosing from EIGHT exact copies 
There’s likely to be six or eight episodes in the first series that will be shown on Friday nights. 
Just like the previous format, it revolves around three singletons hidden from the view of a member of the opposite sex who chooses them based on their answers – rather than their appearance. 
The new version will be up against ITV’s Take Me Out and Meet The Parents. Like us on Facebook
